ordinances of the city of gulfport mississippi of a general and permanent nature source materials used in the preparation of the the 1963 as supplemented  and ordinances subsequently adopted by the city council the source of each section is included in the history note appearing in parentheses at the end thereof the absence of such a note indicates that the section is new and was adopted for the first time with the adoption of the use of the comparative tables appearing in the back of this volume the reader can locate any section of the 1963 as supplemented and any subsequent ordinance included herein the chapters of the been conveniently arranged in alphabetical order and the various sections within each chapter have been catchlined to facilitate usage footnotes which tie related sections of the which refer to relevant state laws have been included a table listing the state law citations and setting forth their location within the included at the back of this volume numbering system the numbering system used in this the same system used in many state and municipal codes each section number consists of two component parts separated by a dash the figure before the dash referring to the chapter number and the figure after the dash referring to the position of the section within the chapter thus the first section of is numbered 41 and the third section of is 63 under this system each section is identified with its chapter and at the same time new sections or even whole chapters can be inserted in their proper place simply by using the decimal system for amendments by way of illustration if new material consisting of three sections that would logically come between sections 61 and 62 is desired to be added such new sections would be numbered 611 612 and 613 respectively new chapters may be included in the same manner if the new material is to be included between chapters 4 and 5 it will be designated as care should be taken that the alphabetical arrangement of chapters is maintained when including new chapters new articles and new divisions may be included in the same way or in the case of articles may be placed at the end of the chapter embracing the subject and in the case of divisions may be placed at the end of the article embracing the subject the next successive number being assigned to the article or division index the index of the been prepared with the greatest of care each particular item has been placed under several headings some of the headings being couched in lay phraseology others in legal terminology and still others in language generally used by government officers and employees there are numerous cross references within the index itself which stand as guideposts to direct the user to the particular item in which he is interested looseleaf supplements a special feature of this which the attention of the user is especially directed is the looseleaf system of binding and supplemental servicing for the this system the be kept uptodate periodically upon the final passage of amendatory ordinances they will be properly edited and the appropriate page or pages affected will be reprinted these new pages will be distributed to holders of copies of the with instructions for the manner of inserting the new pages and deleting the obsolete pages successfully keeping this todate at all times will depend largely upon the holder of the volume as revised sheets are received it will then become the responsibility of the holder to have the amendments inserted according to the attached instructions it is strongly recommended by the publisher that all such amendments be inserted immediately upon receipt to avoid misplacing them and in addition that all deletedpages be saved and filed for historical reference purposes acknowledgments the publication of this under the direct supervision of milton e lefkoff supervising editor and ronald k mclaughlin editor of the municipal tallahassee florida credit is gratefully given to the other members of the publishers staff for their sincere interest and able assistance throughout the project the publisher is most grateful to mr james k wetzel city attorney mr raymond m mathers chief administrative officer and ms sandra e baylor deputy city clerk for their cooperation and assistance during the progress of the work on this is hoped that their efforts and those of the publisher have resulted in a ordinances which will make the active law of the city readily accessible to all citizens and which will be a valuable tool in the daytoday administration of the citys affairs municipal code corporation tallahassee florida adopting ordinance ordinance no 1826 an ordinance adopting and enacting a new code of ordinances of the city of gulfport mississippi  establishing the same  providing for the repeal of certain ordinances not included therein and providing when this ordinance shall become effective be it ordained by the mayor and city council of the city of gulfport mississippi that this ordinance consisting of chapters 1 each inclusive is hereby adopted and enacted as the ordinances of the city of gulfport mississippi and shall be treated and considered as a new and original comprehensive ordinance which shall supersede all other general and permanent ordinances except such as by reference thereto are expressly saved from repeal or continued in force and effect for any purpose that all provisions of such be in full force and effect on and after the 3rd day of january 198 and all ordinances of a general and permanent nature of the city of gulfport not in such recognized and continued in force by reference therein are hereby repealed from and after the effective date of this ordinance that the repeal provided for in hereof shall not affect any offense or act committed or done or any penalty or forfeiture incurred or any contract or right established or accruing before the effective date of this ordinance  nor shall such repeal affect any ordinance or resolution of the city promising or guaranteeing the payment of money by or to the city or authorizing the issuance of any bonds of the city or any evidence of the citys indebtedness or any contract or obligation assumed or incurred by the city  nor shall such repeal affect the administrative ordinances or resolutions not in conflict or inconsistent with the provisions of this   nor shall such repeal affect any right or franchise granted by any ordinance or resolution to any person firm or corporation  nor shall such repeal affect any ordinance dedicating naming establishing locating relocating opening paving widening vacating etc any street or public way in the city  nor shall such repeal affect any ordinance making appropriations  nor shall such repeal affect any ordinance levying or imposing taxes  nor shall such repeal affect any ordinance providing for local improvements and making assessments therefor  nor shall such repeal affect the zoning ordinances amendments and variances  nor shall such repeal affect any salary ordinance or resolution  nor shall such repeal affect any ordinance establishing extending or otherwise affecting the boundaries of the city  nor shall such repeal affect any ordinance relating to employee classifications of the city or creating abolishing fixing the duties for or establishing the compensation for any position in the employment of the city nor inconsistent with this   nor shall such repeal affect any ordinance or resolution pertaining to the gulfport municipal separate school district  nor shall such repeal be construed to revive any ordinance or part thereof that has been repealed by a subsequent ordinance which is repealed by this ordinance that a copy of such be kept on file in the office of the city clerk preserved in looseleaf form or in such other form as the city clerk may consider most expedient it shall be the express duty of the city clerk or someone authorized by him to insert in their designated places all amendments or ordinances which indicate the intention of the city to make the same a part of such the same have been printed or reprinted in page form and to extract from such provisions which may be from time to time repealed this copy of such be available to all persons desiring to examine the same and shall be considered the official ordinances of the city that in case of the amendment of any section of such which a penalty is not provided the general penalty as provided in of this shall apply to the section as amended  or in case such amendment contains provisions for which a penalty other than the aforementioned general penalty is provided in another section of such the penalty so provided in such other section shall be held to relate to the section so amended unless such penalty is specifically repealed therein that it shall be unlawful for any person firm or corporation to change or alter by additions or deletions any part of portion of such or to insert or delete pages or portions thereof or to alter or tamper with such any manner whatsoever which will cause the law of the city of gulfport to be misrepresented thereby any person firm or corporation violating this section shall be punished as provided in of the ordinances of the city of gulfport that all ordinances or parts of ordinances in conflict herewith are to the extent of such conflict hereby repealed that this ordinance shall be in force and take effect the 3rd day of january 1989 the above and foregoing after having been first reduced to writing and read by the clerk was introduced by peden seconded by mcdaniel and was adopted by the following roll call vote to wit yeas absent nays jenkins turnbough none mcdaniel peden sinopoli the president thereby declared the motion carried and the this the 3rd day of january 1989 seal attest adopted s anne v peterson clerk of the council s himbert j sinopoli petition of electors for incorporation gulfport miss feb 8 1898 to the honorable a j mclaurin governor state of miss jackson miss the undersigned citizens and legal voters of gulfport harrison county mississippi respectfully petition your excellency to grant them the privilege of incorporation as provided by statute and the laws of the state applicable to the incorporation of cities towns and villages we desire to be incorporated under the name and style of the town of gulfport mississippi our present population exceeds five hundred 500 souls the limits of said town shall be as follows beginning at a point on the seashore three quarters of a mile east of the center of the track of the gulf and ship island railroad where said railroad enters the waters of the gulf or mississippi sound thence due south one 1 mile into the said mississippi sound  thence in a westerly direction parallel with the shore and one 1 mile therefrom to a point opposite the seashore thirteen hundred and twenty 1320 feet from and west of the dividing line of sections eight and nine of township eight south range eleven west  thence due north to the said point on the seashore and thence due north one mile and a half 112 or thereabouts  thence east to and along the northern boundary as per plat of the town of gulfport on file in the chancery clerks office until a point due north of the point of beginning is reached  thence south to the place of beginning on said seashore of mississippi sound your petitioners would most respectfully ask your excellency to appoint the following named parties as mayor and alderman sic of said town to serve under this incorporation until their successors shall be elected and installed viz f b hewes mayor  a mcalpin o t cassibey j j thornton and e m lake aldermen and as in duty bound your petitioners will every pray h e richardson j t miller w s champlain jos b leger j s richardson t g bailey e c harris e langnulty j f mahoney w c palmes w e richardson jas tunney a d pierce t p gary a l thornton thos e goode j r kelly w t crane s howard j s havard t e mccreary a j courtright s mcneil s o lee w s hughes allen e cameron chas mcneil chas barnard a mcalpin wm t moorman g e forstall e m lake w s cooper j e cruthunds f w odom l g seukee s t bullis e j younghams s simonson j w jackson a murdock p l barnes thos cauham 1898 incorporation proclamation state of mississippi executive department to all to whom these presents shall comegreetings whereas a petition signed by twothirds of the electors residing within the proposed limits of the town of gulfport in the county of harrison has been presented to me setting forth the metes and bounds of said town and stating the number of inhabitants to be five hundred 500 and the said petition having been published for three 3 weeks as required by law now therefore i a j mclaurin governor of the state of mississippi by virtue of the authority vested in me by the constitution and laws of the state do issue this my proclamation declaring the said town of gulfport in the county of harrison incorporated with metes and bounds as follows to wit beginning at a point on the seashore three quarters of a mile east of the center of the track of the gulf and ship island railroad where said railroad enters the waters of the gulf or mississippi sound thence due south one 1 mile into the said mississippi sound  thence in a westerly direction parallel with the shore and one 1 mile therefrom to a point opposite the seashore thirteen hundred and twenty 1320 feet from and west of the dividing line of sections eight and nine of township eight south range eleven west  thence due north to the said point on the seashore and thence due north one mile and a half 112 or thereabouts  thence east to and along the northern boundary line as per plat of gulfport on file in the chancery clerks office until a point due north of the point of beginning is reached  thence south to the place of beginning on said seashore of mississippi sound and the name of the said proposed town is hereby fixed as the town of gulfport and shall exercise all the rights and powers conferred by of the annotated mississippi of 189 and amendatory acts thereto in testimony whereof i have hereunto set my hand and caused the great seal of the state of mississippi to be affixed done at the capitol in the city of jackson this the twentyeighth day of july in the year of our lord 1898 by the governor a j mclaurin j l power secretary of state 1904 proclamation changing town to city recorded nov 14 1904 state of mississippi executive office jackson to all to whom these presents shall come greeting whereas the board of mayor and aldermen of the town of gulfport harrison county mississippi have certified to me that under the census taken by authority of the board of mayor and aldermen of the town of gulfport that it appears that the town has increased in population to the number of four thousand one hundred twelve 4112 thereby taking said municipality out of the class to which it has heretofore belonged now therefore i jas k vardaman governor of the state of mississippi by virtue of the authority vested in me by the constitution and laws of the state do issue this my proclamation changing the name of said town of gulfport to the city of gulfport and assigning it to the first class and it shall from and after this date be known and designated as the city of gulfport and shall exercise all the rights and privileges conferred upon municipalities of the first class by of the annotated amendments thereto in testimony whereof i have hereunto set my hand and caused the great seal of the state of mississippi to be affixed done at the capitol in the city of jackson this the effective date of this shall be considered as continuations thereof and not as new enactments  state law reference statutes brought forward deemed to be continuations miss  1119 effect of repeal of ordinances a the repeal of an ordinance shall not revive any ordinance in force before or at the time the ordinance repeal took effect b the repeal of an ordinance shall not affect any punishment or penalty incurred before the repeal took effect nor any suit prosecution or proceeding pending at the time of the repeal for an offense committed or matter covered under the ordinance repealed  state ordinance of the city any act is prohibited or is made or declared to be unlawful or an offense or the doing of any act is required or the failure to do any act is declared to be unlawful or a misdemeanor where no specific penalty is provided therefor the violation of any such provisions of this ordinance of the city shall be punished by a fine not exceeding one thousand dollars $100000 or by imprisonment not exceeding ninety 90 days or both every day any violation of this any such ordinance shall continue shall constitute a separate offense  state law reference penalty for violation of ordinances miss  21131  misdemeanors under state penal laws as criminal offenses against municipalities miss  211319 working city prisoners  credit against fine a persons imprisoned for the violation of city ordinances may be required to work upon the streets avenues and alleys of the city under the direction of the chief of police b every prisoner for each days work he is required to do shall receive credit on his fine and cost assessed against him of thirty dollars $3000 per day until such fine and cost are fully paid and in case the prisoner is serving a sentence of imprisonment each day that he works in serving such sentence shall entitle him credit for equal time on his sentence of imprisonment but in no instance shall a prisoner receive credit on the fine and cost and on the time sentenced to imprisonment for the same work c the chief of police shall file a report with the court clerk of each prisoner working out a fine and the latter shall credit the result of such labor to the fine assessed against such prisoner as the same appears upon his court docket  state law reference credit allowed for labor of convicts miss  47147 custody of prisoners all persons convicted of any violation of any ordinance of the city and sentenced to imprisonment for any period of time or being fined and in default of paying such fine and cost shall be committed to prison until the payment of such fine and cost shall be made and remain in the custody of the chief of police and by him confined in such prison within the corporate limits as may be provided by the mayor and city council or in the event the chief of police should have at any time any person so convicted and imprisoned in his custody and for any cause there should fail to be a sufficient prison or jail provided by the mayor and city council for the safe keeping of the prisoner he may with the consent of the mayor make arrangements with the sheriff of the county for the safe keeping of the prisoner until the mayor and city council shall have provided a safe and sufficient prison for such prisoners  remission of fines and imprisonment the mayor shall have the power to remit fines and forfeitures and to vacate and annul penalties of all kinds for offenses against the ordinances of the city with the consent of the city council however a fine forfeiture or penalty shall not be remitted vacated or annulled unless the reasons therefor be entered on the minutes by the clerk together with and as a part of the order so doing  state law reference similar provisions miss  211515 corporate boundaries municipal tax miss  27275 definitions the words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them herein slot amusement machine or machine means any mechanical device or contrivance which is operated played worked manipulated or used by inserting or depositing any coin slug token or thing of value in which may be seen any picture or heard any music or wherein any game may be played or any form of diversion had officer collecting the tax means the city clerk of the city of gulfport or such other official or employee of the city who collects taxes for the municipality by whatever titles he may be known person means and includes any individual firm partnership joint venture association corporation estate trust or other group or combination acting as a unit and includes the plural as well as the singular in number  state law reference definitions relating to slot amusement machine taxes miss  27273 tax levied the city shall levy assess and collect annual license taxes on machines taxable according to this division located for operation within the corporate limits of the city according to the following schedules 1 for each machine wherein may be seen any picture or heard any music a license tax for each such machine in the sum of twentyseven dollars $2700 2 for each machine not elsewhere specifically taxed in this division wherein or whereby any game may be played or any form of diversion had a license tax for each such machine in the sum of fortyfive dollars $4500 3 for each machine not elsewhere specifically taxed in this division wherein or by means of which children may obtain a ride upon a hobby horse or the figure of any animal or upon the figure of a boat airplane rocket or other such machine a license tax of eighteen dollars $1800 for each machine  license a every person engaged in the business of owning or placing on location for the purpose of operation any slot amusement machine shall file an application for a license with the officer collecting the tax on forms furnished by said officer for that purpose the application shall contain such information as may be required and shall be accompanied by a remittance for the amount of tax and any penalty required b the tax levied shall be due and payable annually on january 1 and all licenses issued under the provisions of this division shall expire annually on december 31 a license may be renewed and stickers affixed to the machine without penalty during the month of january the amount of the license tax to be paid for a period of less than twelve 12 months shall be that proportionate to the annual license tax that the number of months or fractional part thereof remaining until january 1 next bears to twelve 12 months c the officer collecting the tax shall issue a license or sticker on a form to be prescribed by that officer such license or stickers shall be securely affixed or attached to the machine to which it applies in such a manner as to be readily visible and shall be affixed before the machine is operated or played the absence of a proper license or sticker affixed to a machine shall be prima facie evidence of failure to pay the tax levied for operation of the machine d the license shall entitle the owner or the person placing the machine on the location for the purpose of operation to operate a machine of the type specified until december 31 next e when ownership of a machine upon which a valid license or sticker is attached is transferred to another person no additional tax shall be required if the machine is moved to a location in the city from a county or municipality within the state of mississippi in which the machine has been properly licensed then no additional license or tax shall be required or due until the expiration of the current license in no case may a license be transferred from one machine to another machine f no refund shall be allowed for failure or inability to exercise the privilege granted after the license has been issued  state law reference similar provisions miss  27277 penalties a any person engaged in the business of owning or placing on location for the purpose of operation any slot amusement machine without the payment of the tax imposed herein shall be liable for the amount of tax and fifty 50 percent of the amount of the tax as penalty b any person who has paid the tax for the operation of a machine but who has failed to affix the license or sticker to the machine shall also be liable for fifty 50 percent of the amount of tax as penalty c it shall be unlawful for any person to place on location any machine in the city without paying the tax herein levied  state law reference similar provisions miss  27279 exemptions this division shall not apply to any machine operated for legal gaming purposes at a gaming establishment licensed by the mississippi gaming commission to bingo or pulltab machines which are located on the premises of charitable bingo licensees to any machine kept at a regular place of business of distributors or manufacturers for sale or lease without being operated to any pool table operated in any place of business commonly known as a pool hall or billiard parlor when the gross income from the operation of such pool table is taxable under the mississippi sales tax law or to any antique coin machine as defined in  272712 miss amendments thereunto  state law reference exemptions miss  272711 seizure  penalty for interference with officer  custody a the officer collecting the tax or any agent appointed by said officer shall have full and complete authority without an order from any court to take possession of any slot amusement machine and keep seal or otherwise prevent the operation of such machine for failure to pay the license tax and any penalty or for operation of such machine without a proper license or sticker affixed thereto b when such machine shall have been seized or possession taken to prevent further unlawful use thereof the same shall remain under the exclusive jurisdiction of such officer or agent seizing same until released by said officer or agent upon payment of the proper tax penalty and costs or until same is disposed of under a writ of venditioni exponas issued by the proper court for the collection of the taxes due together with penalties and costs c any operation of any machine after seizure of same or any disturbance of possession or notice of seizure posted by an agent or officer shall be unlawful and any person violating this provision shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof may be fined not more than five hundred dollars $50000 or imprisoned in the county jail for not more than six 6 months or may be fined and imprisoned in the discretion of the court within the limitations aforesaid  state law reference similar provisions miss  272715 administration a the administration of this division is vested in and shall be exercised by the officer collecting the tax who may act or her duly appointed and qualified deputies or agents who shall serve under said officer and perform such duties as may be required b  62210 secs 12111224  reserved article vi  municipal court short title this article may be known and cited as the gulfport municipal court  22693 ratification of established municipal court system a statutory authority the municipal court system of the city was established and does operate according to the laws of the state requiring the establishment of a municipal court in all municipalities of the state mca 197  21231 et seq as amended b confirmation and application of state law this article confirms the established municipal court system in the city and provides that the municipal court and its officers shall operate and manage the court according to said state law and any provision of this article declared invalid or in conflict with any state law shall not due to its invalidity affect the validity of any other provision of this article  22693 purpose and intent this article shall codify the established municipal court system for the city and shall enable the municipal court of gulfport to adapt to a more efficient system with more fulltime personnel for the municipal court and shall provide for an enlargement and separation of duties responsibilities and powers  22693 municipal judges a appointments a municipal judge with fulltime employee status shall be appointed by the governing authority and be subject to removal from office in the manner provided for directors or department heads of the municipality additional fulltime judges may be appointed if required by the business of the municipal court if more than one 1 fulltime judge is appointed each judge shall have the same functions duties powers and responsibilities except that only one 1 judge shall be designated by the governing authority as chief judge of the court b assistant or protempore judges in addition to one 1 or more fulltime judges the governing authority as provided by law shall appoint such additional judge or judges to serve as assistant or protempore judge as may be required by the business of the court the assistant or protempore judge shall hear such cases and handle such business of the court as may be assigned by the chief judge or as may be required by absence or conflict of interest of the fulltime judges if the caseload or business of the court requires the holding of court or administration of business by the court by the assistant or protempore judge simultaneously with that of the fulltime judge or judges then the assistant or protempore judge shall be deemed to be serving in the place of and with the same power and authority as the chief or other fulltime municipal judge c powers duties and qualifications of municipal judges the municipal judges of the city shall be licensed attorneys in the state and shall qualify as other employees to work for the city and shall be vested with the same powers and perform the duties provided for municipal judges in the state mca 1972  21237 et seq as amended and related laws d court rules the chief judge of the court shall have the power to make rules for the administration of the courts business to be in writing filed with the clerk of the court and the rules of court shall be furnished to and followed by all other judges of the municipal court prosecuting attorneys and other court personnel and officers of the court as may be directed by the judge  22693 court administrator a court administrator position established  appointment the governing authority of the city established the position of court administrator by resolution adopted on  and this article shall ratify codify and take precedence over all prior actions of the governing authority pertaining to the position of court administrator and court clerk the court administrator shall be appointed by the governing authority and be subject to removal from office in the manner provided for directors and department heads of the municipality b intent and purpose the purpose and intent of establishing the position of court administrator is to establish a fulltime person in the municipal court system of the city to serve as clerk of court and to enlarge upon the duties as clerk to the effect that the court administrator shall manage and coordinate all of the functions of the municipal court as an officer of and subject to the oversight of the municipal court judge and judges this position is intended to function separate from and in cooperation with the police department with all of the powers required for the clerk of court and administrator of the court to function effectively c powers and duties the court administrator shall also be known as and sign all documents required of the city clerk and shall have all powers and responsibilities provided by state law for the clerk of the municipal court msa 1972  212311 et seq as amended and related laws in addition to the duties as court clerk the court administrator shall manage and coordinate the functions of the municipal court and court personnel and all other business related to the court as may be assigned by the municipal judge or judges and the mayor the court administrator shall follow and seek administratively to enforce the written rules of court and to process and enforce the writs and orders issued by the court  22693 capias officer of the municipal court a appointment the governing authority shall appoint a qualified person upon recommendation by the mayor to serve as capias officer of the municipal court also known as warrant officer b qualification and status the capias officer must have a working knowledge of the court system and must have had satisfactory training or be qualified by experience and training to act as an officer of the court to perform the duties and responsibilities hereinafter designated the position requires sufficient knowledge to locate cases on the docket and be able to testify accurately and knowledgeably under oath the capias officer shall be a full time employee of the municipal court and shall be commissioned by the mayor and is not required to be a member of the police department c duties the capias officer shall have such responsibilities as may be assigned by the court administrator for collection of fines and as may be assigned by the municipal judges or the court administrator to enforce writs or orders issued  and shall assist in the validation of capias and warrants for contempt of court in checking the card files dockets and work sheets then making reasonable attempts to serve and return these capias and warrants or writs and to collect the outstanding fines and indebtedness payable to the city the work of the officer shall include filling out custody reports and confinement of persons in contempt subject to arrangements for payment of said debt or for release and the officer shall use available means to locate persons to investigate contempt cases and to prepare for and testify in contempt of court matters and to assist in the transport of prisoners  22693 apart from that of the police officer serving as court bailiff marshal or police officer of the court and the duties of the capias officer shall not interfere with or take the place of the duties of the police officer of the court except as such officer may be assigned by the court to assist one another  and the duties of the capias officer shall be limited to the business of the court or such state law reference rights of riparian owners on gulf coast miss  49159 secs 226245  reserved title this article shall be known as the sand beach gulfport mississippi reserved area of jurisdiction the area encompassed by this article which shall be in full force and effect in such area is as follows the land being situated within the incorporated limits of the city of gulfport and bounded on the east by the centerline of debuys road in the city of gulfport extended southward to the mean high tideline of the mississippi on the west by the corporate limits located immediately west of lewis avenue extended southward to the mean high tideline of the mississippi sound  and on the south by mean high tideline of the mississippi  and on the north by the northern edge of the rightofway of us highway 90 less and except that portion of the sand beach beginning at the intersection of 15th street and us highway 90 and running in a southeasterly direction to the mean high tideline of the mississippi sound and continuing in a southerly direction along the mean high tide to the entrance of the small craft harbor or bert jones yacht basin rights of the public and adjoining landowners a the members of the general public have the reasonable and lawful right of use of the hereinabovedescribed property as a sand beach for passage to and from sunbathing recreation and other uses appropriate to a public sand beach subject to any exceptions and restrictions set forth herein b the record owners and their successors in title of the property adjoining and abutting the sand beach are the owners of riparian and littoral rights both common law and statutory including access to the water for swimming boating bathing fishing and other aquatic pursuits and rights of air light and view and nothing shall be erected constructed or maintained on the surface of the beach to impair any such owners right without his consent such rights however shall never be exercised in such a manner as to deny access of the general public to or its use of the sand beach nor to adversely affect the right of the city to maintain and replenish the beach c the division of the sand beach into categories of use as appearing now and from time to time hereafter by amendments dividing the beach into two 2 or more categories of public use is made to provide for and protect the rights safety and interests of the public and of the adjacent landowners in and on the sand beach and shall be construed and enforced so as to regulate and protect those interests and not to deny access to the beach or to restrict or hamper the right of the city to maintain and replenish the beach permits and rules for creation and kindling of fires on beach a it shall be unlawful for any person or group to create a fire on the sand beach of gulfport mississippi unless a permit for same has first been obtained b any person or group desiring to create a fire on the sand beach shall obtain a permit for same as to time place and location from the gulfport central fire station an applicant for a permit must be at least eighteen 18 years of age and must agree to assume full responsibility for activities in connection with control of the fire and cleaning up all debris and litter resulting from the fire remains of a fire shall not be left covered with sand but should be placed in the nearest waste canister on the beach the permit shall be carried by the permittee to the harrison county sheriffs office at least twentyfour 24 hours prior to the time the fire is ignited and shall be carried at the beach at all times the fire is burning c in addition the central fire station is requested to advise the office of the sheriff of harrison county when a permit is issued prior to the time that a fire is ignited d any person causing a fire to be created or kindled on the sand beach without obtaining a permit as set forth hereinabove or violating any of the rules set forth herein shall be guilty of a misdemeanor punishable by a fine in the amount of not less than twentyfive dollars $2500 and not more than two hundred dollars $20000 e no permit shall be issued for a fire on the sand beach of gulfport unless the following conditions are met 1 the fire must be located at least one hundred 100 feet south of the seawall  2 the fire must be located at least one hundred 100 feet from any pier or other structure  3 the fire shall be composed only of wood which shall be piled no higher than three 3 feet and no wider than six 6 feet in diameter  4 the fire shall be kept under control at all times and shall be constantly attended by a competent person until the fire is completely extinguished  5 all debris shall be removed by the permittee  6 in addition the city public safety official authorized to issue fire permits shall not issue such permit if a determination is made that it is unsafe to do so after consideration of the following factors a the direction and intensity of the wind  b the amount of recent rainfall in the vicinity of the proposed fire  c the location of combustible structures materials or vegetation in the vicinity of the proposed fire even though beyond one hundred 100 feet of the proposed fire  d the current pressure in the water supplies in the vicinity of the proposed fire the location of the nearest fire hydrant and any other factor which would affect the ability of the nearest responsible fire department to contain or control a fire cross reference fire prevention and protection  1026 et seq state law reference fire protection miss  45111 in the proffered license is so restrictive and unreasonable as to constitute an interference with the free public use of the sand beach by all members of the general public in accordance with valid laws ordinances and police regulations within the meaning of paragraph iii of the final judgment entered  in federal civil action number 2262 3 notice of appeal shall be in writing and shall be days after receipt of such written notice of appeal both the appellant and the issuing authority shall be entitled to be represented by counsel and to present oral and documentary evidence on the single issue defined above 4 if the appeal shall be denied the appellant may accept the proffered license by written acceptance and compliance with requirements within ten 10 days lacking which the license shall become and be void and withdrawn if the appeal shall be successful in whole or in part the city council will modify the license to conform to their decision and the appellant shall have ten 10 days to accept the modified license and comply with its requirements failing in which the modified license shall become and be void and cancelled g no license either rental or sales shall safety miss  592181 et seq  seawalls miss  65331 et seq regulations relating to beach maintenance a in order to permit orderly cleaning and maintenance of the beach vendors shall observe the following rules 1 vehicles merchandise and all other items shall not be placed so as to hamper maintenance vehicles and equipment in their use of access ramps or to interfere with regular vehicle movement across the beach 2 each vendor is responsible to see that merchandise is collected and stacked stored or grouped and all litter removed so that beach maintenance vehicles can move freely in the area at night and early morning hours without damage either to the merchandise or property of the vendor or to the maintenance vehicles 3 if complete freedom of movement of maintenance vehicles cannot be provided the vendor shall so notify the beach patrol giving his reason for failure to provide freedom of movement b the right of riparian owners to at their own risk leave small boats on the beach anchored to stakes is recognized subject to such beach use not interfering with regular maintenance and clearing of the beach in order to ensure such freedom to clear and maintain the beach riparian owners must observe the following rules 1 boats must not be clustered or grouped and must be separated by a distance of at least forty 40 feet 2 only boats owned or authorized by the riparian owner may be left on the beach 3 the anchor or stake to which the boat is affixed shall be of such size and color as to be clearly visible to beach maintenance personnel 4 boats may not be staked or anchored at both ends so as to prevent the boat from being swung to one 1 side to permit maintenance of the area around and under the boat c when in the judgment of the city council it is necessary to temporarily close any part of the beach for replenishment or heavy maintenance an order for such closing will be entered on the minutes of the city council specifying the reason for closing and the estimated period of time the affected section of the beach will be closed such order shall be entered at least thirty 30 days prior to the date fixed for closing the beach and a copy of such order will be published one 1 time in a newspaper having general circulation in the city d the beach may also be closed by reason of hurricane warnings on order of the civil defense officials of the city and in the event of such closing all vendors merchandise vehicles and other property and all movable structures of every kind will be removed from the beach all persons having no official duties on the beach will be barred from the beach area during such danger periods e dumpsters for collection of garbage and trash will be located on the beach only at points approved by the sand beach patrol no dumpster shall be so placed as to interfere with beach maintenance vehicles and equipment or their access to ramps leading onto the beach sanctuary area for least terns and other special use areas a the least tern sanctuary area shall be governed by the following regulations 1 any person found molesting or destroying least tern nests harassing the terns or engaging in other actions adversely commission 2 the city council does hereby expressly request the state game and fish commission to specifically recognize the least tern nest areas herein established and to extend its protection to said areas as provided by law c by amendment to this article there may be designated certain high use activity areas of the sand beach which areas shall be subject to additional regulations d from month lease a permanent marina tenant may terminate the vessel dockage agreements upon fifteen 15 days written notice in the event a marina tenant vacates his slip without giving the obligatory 15day notice the marina tenant will continue to be charged the monthly slip rent fee and electrical charge until such time as the vessel dockage agreement is terminated marina tenants who properly provide the 15day notice of their intent to terminate their vessel dockage agreement will be refunded any slip rent and fees less any outstanding fees or charges not otherwise used in the monthly rent cycle minor and general in nature must be done elsewhere and the vessel must be moved to a location away from the marina for that activity minor maintenance to the brightwork and woodwork is permissible but excessive ie where dust or particulate causes impact beyond the footprint of the vessel where work is being performed sanding with motorized tools and spray painting of any kind is prohibited at all times within the marina mechanical structural engine transmission and other similar repairs beyond normal routine maintenance are not permitted in the marina and must be conducted at a location away from the marina    5311  exh a 6716  unsightly dangerous boats vessels that are of an unsightly appearance or in deteriorated condition or in an unseaworthy condition  based on the harbormasters opinion and viewpoint  are prohibited from renting any slip space or tying up anywhere in the marina except temporarily at the fuel dock for the purpose of taking on fuel and supplies if such a vessel is experiencing an emergency situation or cannot return to sea because of inclement weather said vessel may be permitted temporary dockage only until the emergency or weather has abated vessels that have become dangerous or a nuisance may be deemed as a public nuisance owners of dangerous or public nuisance vessels including sunken or partially sunken vessels that remain berthed in the marina will be given notice by the harbormaster to require that the dangerous condition or nuisance be corrected andor abated immediately failure of the owner to resolve the situation immediately but no later than three 3 days from the date of the notice will result in the city taking such steps as necessary to remove the danger or nuisance and to charge the vessel owner with any and all costs incurred by the city for doing so if the danger or nuisance is so extreme in nature that it must be resolved without any delay whatsoever the city at the sole discretion of the harbormaster shall have except marina tenants the marina tenants guests an authorized agent of the marina tenant or the duly authorized employees of the city others will be asked by marina staff to exit immediately the marinas docks and piers defined as any area within the gates and walls of the marina with exception of the boat launch area if the person is not compliant with the marina staff members request the staff member may contact the gulfport police department for assistance in removing said person or persons from the premises   exh a 6716    slips docking power and vessel safety all vessels berthed in a slip are expected minimally to utilize all four 4 tie points ie two 2 stern lines and two 2 bow lines one 1 of each on both the starboard side and port side of the vessel vessels tied sideto along a pier are to use a bow line stern line appropriate spring lines and portable fenders to keep the vessel off the dock tie dock lines are to be of appropriate material sufficient strength and diameter for the size and weight of the vessel being berthed using these guidelines as the minimum expected by the marina vessels under 20 are to use at least 38 line vessels 20 to 30 are to use at least 12 line vessels 30 to 40 are to use at least 58 line vessels 40 to 60 are to use at least 34 line vessels over 60 are to use at least 1 line power cords running from the power pedestal to the vessel must be of the marinerated twistlock type and rated for the power being delivered 30 50 or 100 amp power cords must be certified marine grade and must be in watertight factory condition ie power cords may not be repaired or retrofitted in any manner except the replacement of the ends with marineapproved equipment so designed for the repair power cords must be of sufficient length to permit slack at all times between the vessel and power pedestal and they are to be secured in a manner that will prevent them from hanging in the water or pulling on the power pedestals outlet adaptors intended to change the configuration of the power pedestals outlet type may not be utilized and household extension cords  regardless of rating  are strictly prohibited outside the confines of the vessel power pedestals are to remain unlocked at all times the harbormaster and the marina staff shall retain the right to board any vessel at any time with or without marina tenant permission for the purpose of ensuring ensure vessel safety marina safety safety to others and for due diligence when any abnormality no matter its origin is directly observed or reported as such by others  exh a 6716    marine heads and pump out services free pump out service for the sole purpose of emptying sewage from the vessels holding tank is provided twentyfour 24 hours a day on each dock and for each slip and is also provided at the fuel dock marina tenants shall make contact with the harbormaster or the marina staff whenever a pump out is required mississippi law prohibits discharge of any sewage treated or untreated into the states waters including the waters of the marina any recreational vessel berthed in the marina that also has on board a functional marine head must additionally have on board an operable marine sanitation device msd that is of a type certified by the us coast guard for the size vessel affected all msds must be configured in a manner that meets or exceeds uscg regulations for same  exh a 6716 the animal owner at no time may domesticated animal waste be washed or thrown overboard into the waters of the marina or the mississippi sound  exh a 6716    severe weather and hurricane plan because severe weather may occur at any time marina tenants must ensure their vessel is always appropriately prepared and secured to handle the potential onslaught of high winds high tides heavy rains or all three 3 at once in the event of an approaching tropical system marina tenants are reminded to monitor the national weather service and make prudent decisions regarding the evacuation of their boat from the marina in the event a tropical system is forecast to raise the seawater level in the marina by at least four 4 feet andor based on other advice from harrison county emergency operation center the harbormaster may order that all marina tenants evacuate the marina and seek safer dockage for their vessels this order shall be prominently posted and updated on the citys web page at wwwgulfportmsgov and the marinas web page at wwwgulfportmarinacom marina tenants who fail to abide by any duly issued order to remove their vessel from the marina will assume any and all liability and responsibility for said vessel and any damage it receives or any damage it may cause to city property or other vessels as a result of the storms impact on the marina and may be denied any future dockage privileges in the marina further marina tenants who fail to abide by any order to remove their vessel from the marina ie a mandatory evacuation of the marina shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and subject to a fine of up to one thousand dollars $100000 each day or part thereof that a vessel remains at the marina after the evacuation deadline established in the evacuation order and before the order is lifted shall constitute a separate offense  exh a 6716    11717    designation of slip sizes all slips in the marina are predesignated in size and include adequate buffer zones both fore implement various incentive and marketing programs as necessary and as appropriate for the purpose of increasing permanent slip occupancy andor transient visits to the marina  exh a 6716  article iv  boat and water safety title this article may be known as the boat and water safety  of gulfport mississippi  area of jurisdiction the provisions of this article shall be applicable to all coastal tidal or navigable waters including rivers lakes and streams and the waters of the mississippi sound lying within the territorial limits of the city except as to any section of this article that is specifically limited to a specified area  purpose the purpose of this article is to provide for and to promote the safety of persons and property in connection with the use operation and equipment of boats and all types of water craft and to promote the use of waterways in a manner consistent with the regulations and laws of the united states and the state of mississippi  and to protect the rights of nearby homeowners to the peaceful use and enjoyment of their property and to provide for enforcement of the laws ordinances and regulations applicable thereunto by all peace officers and law enforcement officials having jurisdiction over such matters including the appropriate federal state county and municipal officials  violations no person shall navigate operate or use a boat or other watercraft in violation of 1 any provision of this article 2 any laws of the state pertaining to boats and vessels as specified by provisions of the mississippi boating law of 196 or subsequent amendments thereto et seq mississippi annotated 3 any rules and regulations adopted by the state boat and water safety commission or any other state or federal commission or agency having such responsibility by virtue of mississippi annotated  penalties except as otherwise provided by section 2116e of this article for violation of any provision of this article the penalties provided by mississippi annotated or subsequent amendments thereto are adopted by this article  applicability all persons owning andor operating andor leasing andor chartering andor in control over any boat or other watercraft in the area of jurisdiction specified in this article shall be governed by the provisions of this article  restriction and regulation applying to gulfport lake and bernard bayou a definitions as used in this section the following words and phrases shall mean gulfport lake that certain body of water within the city known as gulfport lake and referred to by said name in the description of corporate boundaries in the ordinances section 113 said lake being connected by and a part of the bernard bayou water system at the west extremity of the harrison county industrial seaway marine dealers dealers located and licensed in the city who as a conduct of their regular business regularly sell andor repair racing boats official boat races power boat races sponsored and sanctioned as required by this section racing boats any power boat or any aquaplane or similar powerdriven water craft designed for racing  or any other power boat or water craft designed for high speeds that is not effectively muffled to prevent exhaust noise or that uses cutouts sponsor any person association corporation or other legal entity sponsoring or applying for permission to sponsor official boat races on gulfport lake b operation of racing boats to protect the safety of persons using the waters and public launch area of gulfport lake and bernard bayou and the rights of adjoining property owners to peaceful use and enjoyment of their property the operation of racing boats on gulfport lake and bernard bayou shall be prohibited with the following exceptions 1 racing boats shall be permitted to operate and practice on a marked course on the north side of gulfport lake on saturdays only during the hours beginning at  pm and ending at sunset 2 marine dealers shall be allowed to operate racing boats on gulfport lake from  am until sunset from monday from  pm until sunset on saturday for testing purposes as reasonably required by their business the test operation shall be performed in the race area on the north side of the lake only the test operation shall be performed by the dealer dealers representative or employee test operations from monday shall be intermittent and short in duration 3 participants of official boat races shall be allowed to operate racing boats only as hereinafter provided during official boat races c power boat races power boat races of any kind on gulfport lake shall be prohibited except for official boat races complying with the following conditions 1 two 2 official boat races events may be held in any calendar year provided that all conditions hereinafter stipulated are met a third official boat race event may be held in a calendar year if the third event involves a higher level championship event and all conditions hereinafter stipulated are met 2 each official boat race event shall include scheduled races over a period not exceeding two 2 consecutive days on saturdays and sundays only racing boats during the event shall not be operated before  am on saturday and before  am on sunday or after sunset on saturday or sunday where the official boat race is a higherlevel championship event the championship event may include scheduled races over a period not exceeding three 3 consecutive days on fridays saturdays and sundays only racing boats during the championship event shall not be operated before  am on friday and saturday or before  am on sunday or after sunset on friday saturday and sunday 3 no official boat races shall be held until official sanction for the races is given by the united states coast guard and the bureau of marine resources bmr of the state of mississippi or other commission or agency of the state in lieu of bmr properly empowered to authorize and regulate the event 4 no official boat races shall be held until a sponsor has made application to the city and received approval by the city council and mayor to sponsor the event the sponsor shall be responsible for providing adequate protection from marine traffic interference and hazards in addition thereto the sponsor before holding the event shall enter into such indemnity and hold harmless agreement in favor of the city andor lease agreement as the city requires and shall furnish proof of liability insurance coverage according to limits and coverage requirements of the city naming the city as an insured 5 no official boat races shall be held under this section until public notice of the scheduled official boat race to be held at gulfport lake is published in a newspaper of general circulation in the city no less than one 1 week nor more than four 4 weeks prior to the beginning date of the event said publication shall name the sponsor and specify the date and times of the event and shall constitute notice to homeowners in the area and to the citizens of gulfport who use gulfport lake d citizens committee a committee comprising an equal number of homeowners of the city residing within onehalf 12 mile of gulfport lake and an equal number of people consisting of licensed marine dealers of gulfport citizens of gulfport who are racing boat owners and members of the gulf coast power boat association who are citizens of gulfport shall be initially organized by the parks and recreation department and thereafter the committee elected shall name its own members from said groups and control its own meetings and make recommendations to the parks and recreation department for action by the city council as the committee deems to be in the public interest and request public hearings as deemed desirable to regulate the use of the lake and to promote the general safety of the public and the peace of the homeowners in the area the director of parks and recreation of the city shall be an ex officio member of the committee e penalties any person who violates any provision of this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and for first offense shall be subject to the following penalties 1 for first offense by a fine of not less than twentyfive dollars $2500 nor more than two hundred fifty dollars $25000  2 for a second or subsequent offense by a fine of not less than two hundred fifty dollars $25000 nor more than one thousand dollars $100000 or by imprisonment not exceeding ninety 90 days or both f sign the city shall post a sign in the area of the city launch ramp facility to enumerate certain provisions of this article or regulations in effect concerning the use and safety of the gulfport lake and launch ramp property g nonwaiver failure of the city to post and maintain a sign section 2116f or the failure of the citizens committee to organize and function section 2116d shall not excuse violation of any provision of this section    9809 civil liability the owner operator or person in control of a boat or watercraft or both shall be civilly liable for any injury or damage proximately resulting from the negligent failure of such person to comply with any provisions of this article  enforcement a coast guard officials officials of the bureau of marine resources bmr of the state of mississippi or any other state enforcement officers empowered by the state to enforce the laws rules and regulations concerning boat and water safety as provided under mississippi annotated officials of the sheriffs department of harrison county mississippi and officials of the gulfport police department shall have the power and authority to enforce all provisions of this article b invalidity or repeal of any one 1 or more provisions of this article shall estimate the cost of preparation of the record on appeal including but not limited to the cost of the preparation of the transcript and the appellant shall deposit that sum with the city clerk the failure of the appellant to prepay the estimated cost of preparation for the record on appeal including but not limited to the cost of preparation of the transcript may result in dismissal of the appeal for failure to comply with this regulation when the city clerk determines that dismissal may be warranted for failure to comply with this regulation the city clerk shall give written notice to the party in default apprising the party of the nature of the deficiency if the party in default fails to correct the deficiency within seven 7 days after notification the appeal shall be dismissed by 11409   2 12214    2 8718  cross reference amendments revisions  387 definitions and construction of terms the following definitions and rules of construction shall be used in interpreting this article terms not defined in this section shall have the meanings prescribed in the standard plumbing auxiliary vent is an additional vent stack assisting the main vent which passes roof independently back vent is that part of a vent line which connects directly with an individual trap near the fixture and extends either to the main or branch vent pipe caliber size  length the given caliber or size of a pipe is for its standard internal diameter and the length of a pipe is its developed length taken along the centerline distance the distance of pipes from each other or from fixtures is the horizontal distance between centers of pipes or fixture outlets fixture or fixtures when used in general sense applies to all receptacles which receive the house sewage or waste from which water is used as a flush  when used specifically it means any of such receptacles including water closets it also means any tank or other contrivance or heater or vessel water passes to supply hot water to a bathtub sink basin or other vessel where hot water is needed flow line is the extreme top or overflow point of a fixture inspector when used without prefix or affix means the chief inspector charged with the enforcement of the provisions of this plumbing article and the rules contained herein main drain means a lateral or main drain of the horizontal piping of a house drainage system extending from the house drain to its connecting with a main or private sewer and conveying the drainage of one 1 or more buildings on the same lot outside water closet is any closet that is installed in a building detached from the main building and not inhabited or on the porch of a house when it is located in a room which has no door or other opening between it and the main house seal of the trap is the height of the water column measured between the point of overflow and the dip of diversion level separating the inlet and outlet arms of the trap sewer is a general term for a system of horizontal drainage from any building site to main public or private sewer soil or waste vent is that part of the main soil or waste pipe above the highest installed branch or fixture outlet connection extending roof  203 persons authorized to do work all plumbing work shall be performed under the supervision of a qualified licensed master plumber occasionally referred to in this article as master contractors and shall be performed by master plumbers or journeymen plumbers  provided that licensed gasfitters licensed under this article may replace but not initially install floor furnaces wall heaters space heaters or other gas appliances except those connected to water or electrical services subject to permit and inspection as provided herein any person may do the plumbing in the residence owned and occupied by him as a home provided it meets the requirements of this article  cross reference licenses and business regulations ch 5 nonconforming fixtures no fixtures shall be installed and no purpose of inspecting plumbing drainage and ventilation already constructed or in the course of construction repair or alteration and in all cases where the plumbing inspector finds that this article is connected or any portion of the system is used  certificate of inspection when any plumbing work for which a permit has been issued is completed and done in accordance with the rules and regulations of this article it shall be the duty of the plumbing inspector to issue a certificate of inspection to the plumber certifying that the plumbing work has been inspected and approved by him  and water will not be turned on to the premises or meter placed until the plumbing inspectors certificate is in the hands of the water department  testing required all plumbing work must be tested by the plumber in the presence of the inspector before it is accepted when it is inconvenient or impracticable to test the entire work at one time it can be tested in sections  procedure for roughingin tests all roughingin tests must be made with water for such testing the iron extension of the soil pipe outside of the house or building shall be securely closed as shall all branches inlets and other openings of the work to be tested the closing of joints and pipes must be sufficiently tight and strong to withstand the pressure of a column of water reaching to the top of the pipe to be tested with a minimum tenfoot head required the pipe shall then be filled with water to its top and shall stand so without perceptible lowering if the water is lowered by leakage the leakage must be found and made tight by the plumber and the work shall not be approved by the inspector until the water stands at the top without perceptible lowering  testing extensions alteration of existing system in case of extension or alteration of any existing plumbing system the same if new stacks are run shall be tested when roughedin and when completed as hereinbefore provided  fixtures to be open  concealing work before inspection all plumbing fixtures shall be installed as open plumbing and no plumbing or drain laying work shall be covered up until inspected by the inspector or his deputy who shall show his badge of authority on request  inspections plans when special permits issued where special permits are issued the location shall be inspected before the work is started and duplicate plans shall be submitted approved and placed on file these plans shall show the proposed work in plan and elevation  permit and inspection fees the installation enlargement alteration repair removal conversion or devices and fixtures reasonably safe to persons and property as applied to electrical installations and electrical equipment means safe for use in the service for which the installation or equipment is intended without unnecessary hazard to life limb or property  applicability a this article shall apply to all installations of electrical conductors fittings devices and fixtures hereinafter referred to as electrical equipment within or on public and private buildings and premises except as specifically provided in subsection b b this article 1 shall not apply to installations in mines ships or railway cars or to automotive equipment  2 shall not apply to installations used by electricity supply or communication agencies in the generation transmission or distribution of electricity or for the operation of signals or the transmission of intelligence and located within or on buildings or premises used exclusively by such an agency or on public thoroughfares  3 shall not apply to the installations or equipment employed by a railway utility in the exercise of its functions as a utility and located outdoors or in buildings used exclusively for that purpose  4 shall apply to electrical equipment used for radio transmitting stations and shall apply to all electrical equipment used for power supply to radio transmitting equipment but shall not apply to other electrical equipment used for radio transmission  affect on liability this article shall not be construed to affect the responsibility or liability of any party owning operating or installing any electrical regulations issued by the authority thereof conformity with the applicable standards of the underwriters laboratories inc shall be prima facie evidence that such equipment is reasonably safe to persons and property b all commercial buildings will be wired in metal galvanized rigid conduit electrical metallic tubing polyvinyl chloride pvc conduit or afc cabling systems including mc and ac twelve gauge copper or aluminum wire is prohibited the use of aluminum alloy wire in a feeder line is permitted  this includes both interior and exterior premises service panel to sub panel only the secs 32093225  reserved division 3  powers and duties of electrical inspectors duties of inspector it shall be the duty of the electrical inspector or his designee to see that the provisions of this article are enforced and to enforce within the city the statutes of the state relating to the installation and sale of electrical equipment he shall upon application grant permits for the installation and alteration of electrical equipment and shall make inspections of all new electrical installations and reinspections of all electrical installations he shall keep complete records of all permits issued inspections and reinspections made and other official work performed  state law reference municipal officers to take oath of office miss  21153 outside activities interest of inspector or assistants prohibited it shall be unlawful for the electrical inspector or any of his assistants to engage in the business of the sale installation and maintenance of electrical equipment either directly or indirectly and they shall have no financial interest in any concern engaged in such business in the city at any time while holding such office as herein provided for  inspectors right of entry  procedure when dangerous conditions discovered  delegation of authority the electrical inspector shall have the right during reasonable hours to enter any building or premises in the discharge of his official duties or for the purpose of making any inspection reinspection or test of the electrical equipment contained therein or its installation when any electrical equipment is found by the electrical inspector to be dangerous to persons or property because it is defective or defectively installed the person responsible for the electrical equipment shall be notified in writing and shall make any changes or repairs required in the judgment of the electrical inspector to place such equipment in safe condition and if such work is not completed within fifteen 15 days or any longer period that may be specified by the electrical inspector in such notice the electrical inspector shall have the authority to disconnect or order the discontinuance of electric service to such electrical equipment in cases of emergency where necessary for safety to persons or property or where electrical equipment may interfere with the safety to persons or property or where electrical equipment may interfere with the work of the fire department the electrical inspector shall have the authority to disconnect or cause the disconnection immediately of any electrical equipment the electrical inspector may delegate any of his powers or duties to any of his assistants  permit required for electrical work no electrical wiring fitting devices fixtures and equipment shall be installed within or on any building structure or premises nor shall any alteration or addition be made in any such existing electrical equipment without first securing a permit therefor from the electrical inspector except as stated in the following sections  when permit not required no permit will be required to execute any of the classes of electrical work specified as follows 1 minor repair work the replacement of lamps or the connection of portable electrical equipment to suitably permanently installed receptacles  2 the installation alteration or repair of electrical equipment for the operation of signals or the transmission of intelligence  3 the installation alteration or repair of electrical equipment installed by or for an electricity supply agency for the use of such agency in the generation transmission distribution or metering of electricity  4 any work involved in the manufacturing testing servicing altering or repairing of electrical equipment or apparatus except that this exemption shall not include any permanent wiring other than that required for testing purposes  application for permit application for permit in writing describing the work to be done shall be made to the electrical inspector by the contractor installing the work the application shall state the name of the user for whom or for which the work is to be done and shall be accompanied when requested by the electrical inspector by such plans specifications and schedules as may be necessary to determine whether the installation as described will be in conformity with the requirements of this article  scope of permit  deviation from described work the permit when issued shall be for such installation as described in the application and any dedication therefrom shall be supplemented by another application and permit clearly stating the changes involved within twentyfour 24 hours of making such changes  annual permits in lieu of an individual permit for each installation or alteration an multiplication and continued existence in under or outside of a structure of any kind rat stoppage or ratproofing applies to a relatively inexpensive form of ratproofing to prevent the ingress of rats into business buildings from the exterior or from one 1 business building to another it consists of the closing of all openings in the exterior walls ground or first floors basements roofs and foundations that may be reached by rats from the ground by climbing or by burrowing with material impervious to rat gnawing  state law reference rodenticide defined miss  69233d interpretation if any and to repair all breaks or leaks that may occur in the ratproofing unless such breaks or leaks develop as the result of natural deterioration of the building  inspections authorized  notice to abate violations  failure to abate the county health department is empowered to make unannounced inspections of the interior and exterior of business buildings as in the opinion of the county health department may be necessary to determine full compliance with this article and the county health department shall make periodic inspections at intervals of not more than ninety 90 days of all ratstopped buildings to determine evidence of rat infestation and the existence of new breaks or leaks in their ratproofing when any evidence is found indicating the presence of rats or openings rats may again enter business buildings the county health department shall give written notice andor orders to the owners or occupants to abate the conditions found which conditions shall be abated within ten 10 days after receipt of such notice  elimination of extensive harborages whenever conditions inside or under business buildings provide such extensive harborage for rats that the county health department deems it necessary to eliminate such harborage it may require the owner to install suitable cement floors in basements or to replace wooden floors or ground floors or require the owner to correct such other interior rat harborage as may be necessary in order to facilitate the eradication of rats in a reasonable time and thereby to reduce the cost thereof  removing ratproofing making new openings it shall be unlawful under the provisions of this article for the occupant owner contractor public utility company plumber or any other person to remove the ratproofing from any business building for any purpose and fail to restore the same in a satisfactory condition or to make any new openings that are not closed or sealed against the entrance of rats  storage of animal feed all food and feed kept within the city for feeding chickens cows pigs horses and other animals shall be kept and stored in ratfree and ratproof containers compartments or rooms unless kept in a ratproof building  state law reference mississippi commercial feed law of 197 miss  7545151 et seq disposal of dead animals garbage etc on which rats may feed a within the city all garbage or refuse consisting of waste animal or vegetable matter upon which rats may feed and all small dead animals shall be placed and stored until collected by the sanitary department in suitable and sufficient watertight cans or receptacles each having a tightfitting cover  and it is hereby declared unlawful for any person to dump or place on any premises land or waterway any dead animals or any waste vegetable or animal matter of any kind b it shall be unlawful for any person to place leave or dump or permit to accumulate any garbage rubbish or trash in any building or premises in the city so that same shall or may afford food or harborage for rats c it shall be unlawful for any person to permit to accumulate on any premises improved or vacant and on all open lots and alleys in the city any lumber boxes barrels bricks stones or similar materials that may be permitted to remain thereon unless same shall be placed on open racks that are elevated not less than eighteen 18 inches above the ground and evenly
